As I said, this is the first time I see so many people enjoying this doujin ever since the TL came out. It's weird.

She has no need to "start with something normal" after everything we've already seen. If she could really be satisfied with "normal," then her whole corruption meant nothing. This isn't a cock-crazed slut. This is just your average arts major that you can find in your university. This is an appetizer for a meal that we'll never eat. All the previous chapters were buildup to... this. Her "corruption" wasn't enough to change her path in life. The tutor simply left because he got tired of this physically attractive, young and willing girl (in other words, because the plot told him to), and we also don't see the aftermath of the whole boyfriend thing because he was never a character. Not even the forced backstory was enough to make this FMC less empty, devoid of any human emotions. And this is just me scratching the surface of everything that is wrong with this series. Chapter 2, 3 and 4 were just meaningless filler, but the artist kept going because NTR is trendy and he wanted to cash in.

The thing is just because you do depraved stuff for a while doesn't mean you have to continuously escalate.  
At any rate, the ending does not imply that she goes around having normal sex, but that she is starting her slutty college life with something normal. An appetizer of sorts.

So she turned into a slut in the end. Okay? And? I'm pretty sure having sex with random old men is much more depraved than having sex with some young and attractive dude at a welcome party. This chapter is a downgrade compared to what we've already seen. FMC simply proceeds to live a happy and fulfilling university life with no consequences while having normal sex with normal guys. If you think that this is a good ending, then you are objectively wrong. Would've been much more reasonable to see her becoming a prostitute, AV actress, getting pregnant, anything that gives continuity to her descent into depravity. But no. This artist doesn't like to draw women "GeTTiNg HuRt," so they went for a weak and safe ending instead. I guess this is a "good" ending if you usually hate NTR, but objectively speaking, this is a disappointment. Even the artist knew that there would be complaints, and there were.
